alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Washington and central Logan Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Peetz to 5 miles northeast of Midway, or along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Sidney to 9 miles northwest of Akron. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Merino, Iliff, Peetz, Prewitt Reservoir, Padroni, Atwood, Logan Corners and North Sterling Reservoir. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
